sense.name: a verbal answer, written or spoken
sense.examples: John made a sarcastic reply to Mary's question. We received a reply to our letter from the managing director. I am writing in reply to your inquiry about a summer internship.

sense.name: a non-verbal response or gesture to an action
sense.examples: The chess master's reply to the check with a queen sacrifice surprised his opponent. The soldiers sent a barrage of gunfire in reply to the enemy's offense. He taught that the best reply to anger is compassion.

sense.name: the legal response of a plaintiff to a defendant's plea
sense.commentary: REPLY[+event][+speech_act][+legal][+response][+of_plaintiff][+to_plea][+of_defendant] Note: a narrow, legal usage of sense 1
sense.examples: What will be the plaintiff's reply to this plea of not guilty? Her attorneys are preparing a reply to the defendant's plea.
